snippet: The plan, involving a new organization to manage the money, was made by the Facebook chief executive in an open letter to his newborn daughter, Max.
abstract: Facebook co-founder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg says he and his wife Dr Priscilla Chan will give 99 percent of their Facebook shares, currently worth $45 billion, to charitable undertakings; announcement and formation of Chan Zuckerberg Initiative points to growing interest among Silicon Valley billionaires to spread their wealth while still young; scale of project and distribution through limited liability corporation, however, are unusual.

byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and NICK WINGFIELD
byline.contributor: Vindu Goel reported from San Francisco and Nick Wingfield from Seattle. Natasha Singer contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The plan, involving a new organization to manage the money, was made by the Facebook chief executive in an open letter to his newborn daughter, Max.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg Vows to Donate 99% of His Facebook Shares for Charity
